key_points: Susan R. Bailey, M.D., emphasizes the importance of COVID-19 vaccination for health care workers for patient and colleague safety.
Over 300 million doses have been administered in the US and nearly 4 billion worldwide, proving the vaccines' safety and efficacy.
Health care organizations advocate for mandatory COVID-19 vaccinations for health care and long-term care workers.
The surge in COVID-19 cases, driven by contagious variants and unvaccinated populations, highlights the need for vaccination.
Many health care and long-term care workers remain unvaccinated, risking vulnerable populations.
The statement calls for all health care and long-term care employers to mandate COVID-19 vaccinations for their employees.
Support for universal vaccination of health workers is growing among experts and institutions.
Some workers may be exempt from mandates due to medical reasons, but they are a minority.
Existing vaccine mandates have been effective, but historical mistrust in health care institutions must be addressed.
The health care community's leadership in implementing vaccine mandates is encouraged to be a model for all employers.
spokespersons: Susan R. Bailey, M.D. (Immediate Past President, American Medical Association)
